did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Bruce Ferrini paleography collection, circa 4000 B.C.-1800.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Examples of various historical writing systems and scripts, including hieroglyphics on fragments of papyrus, reed sticks with proto-Arabian inscriptions, cuneiform tablets, a bowl inscribed in Etruscan, Aramaic incantation bowls, a bronze piece with a runic inscription, Arabic on cloth fragments, decorated 13th-century Bible leaves, and other writings through the 18th century.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Examples of various historical writing systems and scripts, including hieroglyphics on fragments of papyrus, reed sticks with proto-Arabian inscriptions, cuneiform tablets, a bowl inscribed in Etruscan, Aramaic incantation bowls, a bronze piece with a runic inscription, Arabic on cloth fragments, decorated 13th-century Bible leaves, and other writings through the 18th century.
